blog.name: theloveintheireyes
blog.title: like rlb
blog.description: i'm gonna miss you.

tags: idk man my soul just really hurts
summary:
i wonder about it a lot.
when you made me remember you
when i was nothing but a ghost.
and you came back each time with the...
body:
i wonder about it a lot.

when you made me remember you

when i was nothing but a ghost.

and you came back each time with the promise.

i’m thankful for what you’ve done for me.

all of it

but now i just wish you had not done it.

because you’re leaving me.

and i love you.

reblog.comment:
i wonder about it a lot.

when you made me remember you

when i was nothing but a ghost.

and you came back each time with the promise.

i’m thankful for what you’ve done for me.

all of it

but now i just wish you had not done it.

because you’re leaving me.

and i love you.

and you came back each time with the promise.

i’m thankful for what you’ve done for me.

because you’re leaving me.

and i love you.

summary: Several weeks post-Avengers: Endgame, I would love to offer you all some salient points about the cultural significance of this...
body: Several weeks post-Avengers: Endgame, I would love to offer you all some salient points about the cultural significance of this 22-movie epic, but all I really have to say is that I am 99.9% sure the Winter Soldier was responsible for the Poison Tylenol Murders

tags: this is mostly just me interpreting the film lol
summary: I'd like to think that Steve didn't stay in another timeline just to have a second chance with Peggy. I think he stayed there to...
question: I'd like to think that Steve didn't stay in another timeline just to have a second chance with Peggy. I think he stayed there to atone as well. Steve knows the rules of time travel - nothing he does will affect his original time line. So tried to change as much as he can for the better in that timeline with Peggy. He helped avoid SHIELD from becoming SHIELDRA. He saved Bucky, the Starks, and the little girls from the Red Room. 1/2
answer:
In that other time line, Steve did his best to give Tony and Natasha better lives than in his original time. He spoils them rotten as an overprotective uncle. He visits Wakanda with Bucky for medical help. He worked with another set of Avengers: Ant-Man, Wasp, Winter Soldier, Captain Marvel, & Black Panther. Peggy was more terrifying a director and Nick or Maria ever was. Lots of things happened for better and for worse. Some things stayed the same much to his chagrin. 2/3

Steve’s suit and “GPS” device remained hidden until he was old & Peggy + Bucky were gone. Then he asked someone to make him another shield and provide Pym particles. Only then did he reveal his being from the future and the other Steve still frozen. He returns to the original time line before Tony’s funeral. Steve went to Bucky first, confessed what he had done, then offered the shield. Bucky refused and suggested Sam instead. These HCs are the only way I can see Steve as IC in End Game. 3/3

While it’s definitely possible Steve went back in time to make a better timeline (via changing certain events), I don’t think the film itself supports that interpretation. And, if Steve did/does alter this new timeline (for what he believes is the better) then that raises a lot of questions. One could question whether it really was Steve’s “happy ending” since that would mean he never really stopped fighting the war. 

Endgame frames Steve’s trip back in time as him “going home,” and subsequently living a life he considered “beautiful.” This heavily alludes to him hanging up the shield and retiring to become a family man (just as Tony did in the prime timeline), because it plays back on Steve and Tony’s conversation from the end of Age of Ultron. This is why I strongly believe Steve went back solely to live out his life with Peggy–and this is also Markus & McFeely’s interpretation. While M&M don’t believe Steve created an alternate timeline (and he was Peggy’s husband all along), the emotional thrust of what they propose is that Steve became a “househusband” of sorts, learning to let go of the fight.

That said, Steve did create his own personal timeline for himself (according to the Russos + my own interpretation). Given this, Steve could (in theory) shape this new universe to his desires with what knowledge he does have of the future. He could thwart HYDRA’s takeover of SHIELD, save Bucky, all that good stuff. 

… but eventually his foreknowledge will have little beneficial effect the more the timeline diverges. If Steve makes a few fixes here and there, he’ll soon be back where he started in the present: clueless as to what is going to happen next. 

Steve is also just one man. While he may want to stand up to certain injustices of the time (racial inequality, gender inequality, etc.) there’s little he can do to make the kind of broad sweeping change that time itself can yield. This would also stand in the way of Steve’s ending functioning as his retirement of sorts (where he gets to finally live the family life). He can do his part as a civilian. Protest. All that jazz. But nothing he does will really drastically create any progressive reform–at least not quickly. 

Also, not to be a downer, but it’s highly unlikely many of the people Steve met in the present will never be born in Steve’s alternate 1945 timeline. Tony, Natasha, Sam, Bruce, Clint, Sharon, etc. were all born post-1945, which means they haven’t yet been conceived. The chances are nearly zero that all of them will happen to be conceived in this new branch of reality due to the butterfly effect. By Steve going back in time, he’s irrevocably altered the flow of events in such a way that it’s improbable the same couplings and sperm/eggs will collide to create all the same people. While the MCU may ignore something like this, it’s hard for me to do the same. I can’t fathom the alternate timeline also have a Tony, Nat, etc. of their own.

Which means by going back to 1945, Steve eliminated the future existence of his friends from that timeline. Not maliciously, but just by virtue of being there. 

In the end, it seems there’s billions of other universes out there–some near carbon-copies of the MCU, some most likely wildly divergent. For every universe there’s a Steve Rogers, there could be three million without one. So the moral debate of what Steve did (on a temporal scale) is debatable as the multiverse is a thing. He didn’t erase anyone who wouldn’t have (or doesn’t already) exist in another universe. 

That said, it can’t be ignored Steve still created an entire damn universe for his own personal gain. He chose to go back to 1945–a time where inequality was rampant in the United States. He chose to go back to a woman he knew would move on to another man (and have two kids). His choice raises the question of, “What happens when that timeline’s Steve is found in the ice? Did 2023!Steve lie about his origins? Did 2023!Steve make any attempt to rescue himself from this timeline? Does alt!Peggy know? Why is alt!Peggy okay with being with 2023!Steve when she knows her Steve is still alive?” All these questions (and more) are why people hotly debate his ending–and some will never be okay with it.

Like, in a way, what Steve did is just a little different from what Kingpin was attempting to accomplish in Into the Spider-Verse. He wanted to restore his family by ripping them from an alternate universe–even if they weren’t his family.

blog.name: iwouldvebeendrake01
blog.title: writing magic
blog.description: writer. infj. pisces. reader. dreamer.

summary: Honestly, my character [Natasha] has had such an interesting journey, because I started out in Iron Man 2 as basically, like, a...
text: Honestly, my character [Natasha] has had such an interesting journey, because I started out in Iron Man 2 as basically, like, a glorified secretary who kicks ass on the side, and then got to really peel back the layers and build an actual person, not just like this sexy secretary sidekick, played-out version of someone. So as the ten years have passed, it’s amazing to see how important it has been for all these different studios to catch up with what’s going on in the real world and what’s going on in the zeitgeist, and what’s important to fans and audience members, and really, it’s the audience and fans that have pushed the studios like Marvel to come into this century and to really show the characters that represent what’s going on in this world, so it’s really awesome to feel a part of that, you know?
source: Scarlett Johansson in an Avengers: Endgame interview on how important it is to play a strong female character (2019)

reblog.comment: Scarlett Johansson in an Avengers: Endgame interview on how important it is to play a strong female character (2019)

summary: also can i just say that the fact that antman sees two birds flying around and is immediately like ‘guys we did it!!!’ implies...
body:
also can i just say that the fact that antman sees two birds flying around and is immediately like ‘guys we did it!!!’ implies that. like. there are no birds after thanos? 

i mean. what else am i supposed to get from that.

blog.name: ririsasy
blog.title: ♤ Do No Harm But Take No Shit ♤
blog.description:
ME : A drifter, Lone wonderer, an outer space kinda creature, movie enthusiast, I am in rapid change so be prepare for me switching fandom, Marvel, GoT, Star wars, Hannibal, Detroit become humans, harry potter, fantastic beasts, everything tolkien, star trek, one punch man, naruto, the dragon prince, avatar the last air bender, etc, anything I find interesting along the way that suck me up in their orbits. My inbox is always open, talk to me about anything.
(Profile picture by Agnes-cecile in Deviantart)

tags: live so shortly but so beautiful
summary:
Butterfly lovers
They were on Titan, the threat was imminent, Stephen must do something, he has to be prepared, he had heard...
body:
Butterfly lovers

They were on Titan, the threat was imminent, Stephen must do something, he has to be prepared, he had heard about their enemy Name Thanos from Bruce briefly, about his strenght, what he possesed, his goal and Quill added the information as much as he could about the Titan who is unfortunately also his girlfried father, and from them, Stephen knew, he need to use the time stone, to move forward in time and see the autcome of their battle.

He saw the first one and it nearly teared him a part about how much they lost, what it will cost, so he keep going, there must be another way.

The time felt like it slipped right out of his fingers, moving so fast, his current body couldn’t take the speed and he had trembled, shaken and dropped to the ground when the time stone prevented him from going further.

He created millions realities by playing chess with the possibilties, changing one piece after another in order for them to get a different end so they could win.

Tony caught him readily, staring into his eyes, questioning, worried, trying to give him a comfort, and Stephen didn’t even know where to begin or what to say after he saw each of the 1,400,605 possibilities of the life Tony might live and each one of it ending with their lost and Tony sacrifices himself over and over again, he sat there helpless with their destiny.

He wish this man could be selfish just once and take his happy ending until he is gray and old, dying in his bed because of old age, not like this, not like the one he saw him did.

He gazes into those almond big brown eyes, he saw the man he wishes he could protect and have a chance to love but he saw their future already, the helpless end of the man he grew to love in a short time that felt like lifetime.

He had tried his best, he wishes that Tony knew that, searching and searching for another way out, fourteen million times wasn’t enough, he need more time.

And the destiny arrived and he settled into dust with Tony’s face as the last thing that he saw.

He woke up after the dust, at the same spot, five years in the future, precisely like what he had seen, he wishes he didn’t have to face this last encounter with the man he grew to adore, seeing how much he was willing to sacrifice, he reminds him of a man Stephen always see in the mirror.

It’s not about him and it’s not about them, it’s about the fate of half the universe who unjustly disappeared because Thanos decided to play God, this is about the right thing to do. 

The panicked kid was beside him, Peter asking about his mentor, a father figure more likely, Quill and his friends also standing around him, he understands his part in all of this, what he needs to do to help them win this fight, he explained to them that they need to go back to Earth because they need them now to defeat Thanos.

He’s afraid that he didn’t have enough time to gather everybody after shortly explaning everything to his fellow msytic arts and ask for their help to spread the words across the universe, even though he didn’t tell anyone what it will cost, this is the burden he chose to carry alone. 

Tony approched him and his heart beats wildly, he had the urge to shush his own heart to be still, afraid even through the echo of battle that Tony stark could his heart calling out his name. He didn’t tell him when he asked him about their fate, his fate, how could he mutter such a word, knowing what he had chose. Giving up the stone to Thanos meaning he had gave up on Tony, because he had chose this reality.

Tony tirelessly keep fighting the battle and Stephen couldn’t tear his eyes away even when he held the flood up, preventing them from drowning in the battlefield.

He knew exactly about this exact moment, his whole being stunned and in daze for a moment when Tony looked at his way, helpless on the ground, vulnerable beyond measure.

And he did what he should do, to end this war once and for all, he raised his finger and just by one simple look Tony knows what it takes to win, he didn’t hesitate, not once, with the gauntlet on his hand.

Stephen almost screams as he snaps his fingers because This will be the last time he ever sees him, he didn’t rush to his side as Tony weakly sat there, half burn by the power of infinity stones, he is a mere mortal who won’t survive wielding that much power. 

The spider kid keeps calling his name “Mister Stark” over and over again and it breaks Stephen’s soul apart to hear that plea, wanting Tony to stay alive.

Yet Tony clings to his last breath, hoping to hear permission to leave this world from his wife, wanting to hear that his family will be alright and bless pepper for saying the right thing “we’re gonna be alright, you can rest now.” 

All the heroes and heroines standing around Tony lifeless form. They all were shedding tears for the fallen one, after awhile nobody does anything.

Rhodey finally decided to lift Tony up but Thor,Steve, Peter also rushing to do the same, joining by the other avengers, Clint, Carol, T'challa and many others who manage to get their hands on him.

They decided to pick him up at the same time together, Stephen join them too at the last minute after he dragged his heavy feet to stand by his side, he touched the part where Tony’s hand had burn by the infinity stones, somehow trying to erase the mark with his magic, even though he didn’t succceed.

His cheek stained with more tears he could ever shed again in his entire life.

“Tony, you can rest now, I will see you on the other side” he keeps whispering those words, hoping Tony’s spirit hears him and didn’t feel so alone parting to the other side, all his other loved ones are around him too.

They stand there all in black, sending Tony their last regards, Stephen put on his best suit that look almost too big on him, he didn’t have the appetite to eat since his return to earth, after the battle everything tasted bitter.

His gaze fix into the lake, the symbol of Tony’s heart Pepper put on a flower drift off with the current, Stephen realized as he stood there that he will never meet this man again in this lifetime, he knew that it will take time for him to undo this man from his blood.

Rest in peace my dear, even though it’s often hard for you to believe but it’s true that you are loved so deeply by your friends, your kids, your wife….by me, oh, by me.
